about_the_game:
Welcome to Space Extraction Inc.! Whether you chose this job or it chose you doesn't matter because you're now part of the best intergalactic employer with a zero percent termination rate* and an ever-expanding workforce.

At Space Extraction Inc., you won't be tormented by a clueless boss with endless incoherent tasks. Instead, you have the freedom to choose your assignments from those available! The primary goal of these missions is one - to successfully extract objects from abandoned space stations upon requests from our partners - the corporations that own these stations. Currently, our key partner is SovCosMosCorp, and initially, you will be tasked with missions exclusively at their closed space facilities. However, Space Extraction Inc. is in the final stages of signing long-term contracts with two more intergalactic corporations in need of extraction services.

During missions, you'll utilize a monolithic protective helmet that shields your head from dangerous radiation. Don't worry, visibility isn't compromised! The helmet includes an internal display and an external camera almost unaffected by radiation.

Please be aware that not every extraction mission can be successful, as space station terminals may pose certain health threats to visitors**. Unfortunately, mission budgets are very limited, so Space Extraction Inc. cannot allocate additional funds for researching and developing special protective items due to the unknown specifics of potential threats and the uniqueness of extraction missions. However, you can gather certain information about the threats you may encounter during operations and report it to the Employee Life Preservation Development Department. If it turns out that a threat, encountered more than once, can be studied and mitigated, Space Extraction Inc. will be able to develop and provide you with the necessary protective items.

* Premature termination of the contract due to limitation of viability and/or disappearance of a Space Extraction Inc. employee while performing work duties is not considered as grounds for registering the employee's right to termination.
** Clients reserve the right not to disclose the reasons for closing their facilities, which serve as destinations for Space Extraction Inc. employees during their missions. However, Space Extraction Inc. cares about its employees, so together with our partners, we have developed and approved a classification of danger levels at terminals of space stations that have ceased their operations. At Space Extraction Inc., we calculated that knowing the threat level while performing work duties can increase employees' chances of successfully completing a mission by 16.34%!

content_descriptors.notes: Scenes of abstract violence may be demonstrated. Splashes of blood can be shown without reflecting actual injuries that lead to bleeding; unnatural, almost cartoonish deformation of limbs (enlargement/reduction/narrowing) may be depicted.

name: Fatal Terminal

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 x64
  • Processor: Quad-core CPU (Minimally tested on AMD Phenom II x4)
  • Memory: 4096 MB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 1050
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Any
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: A retrofuturistic co-op horror about extracting secret objects from abandoned space stations for corporate clients.
